3.text:
Hello, we're looking at Sandro Botticelli's
'Venus and Mars', which is one of

6.text:
my favourite paintings in the collection, 
because it's so full of irreverent and naughty fun.

13.text:
Here we have on the left hand-side Venus,
who is lying, looking very awake and alert.

20.text:
She is wearing a fantastic,
beautiful gown with gold trim.

23.text:
And she is looking over this side at Mars,
who is fast asleep, he is completely worn out;

30.text:
and if we didn't get that, this little boy
is blowing a shell in his ear, and that's

35.text:
not waking him up, and on top of that there
are wasps buzzing around his head,

39.text: and that's not waking him up either.

41.text:
They are lovers, and Botticelli has
chosen this scene to show them

45.text: when they are after the act of love,

48.text: and he is absolutely worn out.

54.text:
Venus is married to Mars's brother
Vulcan, the God of the Underworld,

58.text:
and this particular moment, although not from
any particular text, shows them being lovers.

66.text:
Behind them are these wonderful little
boys with hairy legs: satyrs.

69.text:
They are playing with Mars's armour,
so he is literally un-manned.

74.text:
He is literally turned from this violent God
of War into this prone, useless figure.

80.text:
And I particularly love this little boy
here climbing through Mars's breastplate

84.text: with this wonderful naughty look on his face.

88.text:
Botticelli is clearly talking about
the sexual element of love,

92.text: and the sexual element of relationships.

94.text:
He is not I think saying that women
are better than men, what he is trying

98.text:
to talk about is the nature of the
relationship between men and women.

102.text:
He is also relating it to a wider cosmic
idea of our place in the world.

107.text:
If we look into the sky, we look at the stars,
Venus is always triumphant over Mars.

112.text:
And one of the things Botticelli is trying
to say is if we understand our place in the world,

116.text:
we understand how to be happy people,
and how to be better off.
